dialog: Open the door, open the door.
Can you please stand up and take us to the cash drawer, ma'am?
There's no money in the drawers yet.
It's in the safe and I ain't got the code.
Y'all are new at this, I'm guessing.
I told you, it's in the safe.
He'll be here soon and I suggest you fellers don't be.
All you're guilty of right now is being stupid.
Just leave and that's all it'll be.
What time does Mr. Clauson get here?
What time does Mr. Clauson get here, huh?
Where do you think you're going?
You didn't have to hit him.
See, little brother, not a worry in the world.
Planning this and doing it is two different things.
Maybe we should get there ahead, get up to Olney.
I found these coins in the barn.
Lord knows how long they've been sitting there.
I've been living off an inmate's diet, and had all these coins sitting right underneath a bunch of feed sacks.
I wonder if any of these is collector's items.
You could be sitting on a fortune here.
Ones, fives, 10s, 20s, no hundreds, no bundles.
Put your hands on the counter.
Okay You ought to be ashamed of yourselves.
Hands on the counter where I can see them!
You got a gun on you, old man?
You're damn right I got a gun on me.
Are you gonna get his gun?
Keep up with the circumstances, okay?
So are y'all gonna steal my gun, too?
Put the gun on the counter?
You trying to get us killed?
I ain't stealing from some old man.
We're stealing from one place, that's it.
You're turning out to be a poorass criminal.
See what the early bird gets?
Maybe we should hit that branch in Jayton?
We hit those banks first thing in the fucking morning, when they're empty.
When they're empty, God damn it!
It's the last time I care to be shot at.
We're a ways from being finished.
Shit, I can do this all week.
We're like the Comanches, little brother, raiding wherever we please with the whole of Texas hunting our shadow.
You hear about these bank robberies?
Why are you always dressed like me?
You can wear whatever color shirt you choose.
Ranger regs say white, blue, or tan dress shirts.
Stands to reason every once in a while we're gonna be dressed the same.
Well, you know what they say about imitation, Alberto.
You wanna hear about these bank robberies, or you'll just sit there and let Alzheimer's run its course?
Texas Midlands the branch in Archer City and the branch in Olney.
Midlands ain't got any branches outside Texas.
Plus, they're just hitting the drawers for a few thousand.
You may get to have some fun before they send you off to the rocking chair yet.
Who the hell gets drunk off a beer?
You got anything else you wanna say?
There's not a decent steak in the whole lot of them sorry sons of bitches.
Yeah, well, while you were busy in jail, I was busy looking after Mama, so you can go fuck yourself.
Was she in that bed awhile?
The end there was pretty rough.
I could've helped out a little if she asked.
I could've fed them skinny cows.
We had nothing to feed them.
Well, I could've helped clean up the house a bit.
Never took you for the goto guy for house cleaning.
She never wanted nothing to do with me anyway.
By Friday it all goes to my boys.
She didn't mean nothing by it.
She always hated me for standing up to him.
You never understood that fighting back makes the beating last longer.
That's why I stopped fighting and shot that son of a bitch.
Somebody robbed the bank this morning.
If you see anyone looking a little sideways, give me a call.
Find itself on the wrong end of a short rope.
Oh, well, that would simplify things for everyone but you.
Maybe, if you can find the tree.
Took the drawer money,  No ink pack?
Can we get a look at the video?
Let me introduce you to the bank manager, Mr. Clauson.
Can we get a look at the surveillance video?
We got cameras, but they're switching us over to a digital system that feeds into the computer.
These new cameras don't hook to our VCRs.
Call over the Young County Sheriffs.
Ask them if they thought to hook their cameras to some sort of recording device.
A little early in the morning for tweakers.
They rob drug stores and parked cars, not banks.
Can I take a look inside?
So they bopped you in the snozzola, huh?
I know their faces was covered, but could you tell their race?
Let's leave their souls out of this for now.
From around here somewhere is my guess, you know, from their voices.
Young County says same deal with the branch in Olney.
Same deal all the way around.
Doesn't Walmart sell all sorts of electronic equipment?
Well, these boys, they aren't done yet, I'll tell you that.
They're just sticking to the drawers, not taking the hundreds.
They're trying to raise a certain amount.
It's gonna take a few banks to get there.
Your boys know how rich they're gonna be?
You take them to the funeral?
Like I said, they don't know anything.
When's the last time you saw them?
When we all went to the rodeo in Stamford right after you got out.
I talk to them on the phone.
You talk to them on the phone?
You got any idea how much I owe Debbie in child support?
You've got enough in your front pocket to fix that problem right now.
We can't spare it, you know that.
Maybe we should hit another branch.
You know, you talk like we ain't gonna get away with this.
I've never met nobody who got away with anything, ever.
Then why in the hell did you agree to do it?
I got to shit like an old goat.
Grab the check, meet me out front.
Well, if that isn't a hint, I don't know what is.
Well, you've got a ways to go yet.
Yeah, you'll be waiting around all day for me to finish this.
I'll be here whether you finish it or not, so...
Fan them out like a deck of cards.
No, there ain't nothing highdollar about drilling.
No one seems to be drilling for gas now, anyway.
I mean, ain't one drill the same as the next?
Guess I got to get someone else to believe me.
I bet you don't owe this much in child support.
I must be out of my goddamn mind to ask you for help.
That's not part of the plan.
Now, we got to go back to the ranch and bury the car.
I'm not driving a stolen getaway car to a fucking Indian casino.
You just put us a goddamn day behind.
Well, I got us a day ahead this morning, so I guess we're even.
Can't you answer your own phone?
I'm driving. You're just sitting there twiddling your fat fingers.
It's reckless is what it is.
I don't think these boys is reckless.
They know exactly what they're doing.
I don't know how you're gonna survive without somebody to outsmart.
You need a hobby, and quick.
A horse would only remind me of her.
Not enough to do it every goddamn day.
Yeah, when I retire, I'm gonna move Esme and me down to Galveston.
Gonna live on that son of a bitch right at the pier.
Maybe one of these bank robbers is gonna want a gunfight and I can dodge my retirement in a blaze of glory.
There won't be much glory in it.
Oh, well, I'm lucky I got a halfbreed by my side to avenge me.
If you can stay sober long enough, knowing how you lnjuns like the bottle.
Why in the shit would we do that?
This kicked up on the highway, been chasing us ever since.
Wish we could do something for you.
Ought to just let it turn me to ashes, put me out of my misery.
to the river with a herd of cattle.
And I wonder why my kids won't do this shit for a living.
Go, go! go You wanna call it in?
Oh, it's gonna burn out when it hits the Brazos.
No one to call around here, anyway.
No, these boys is on their own.
I still don't see the problem, Toby.
Well, the problem is, thanks to you, we have to spend tomorrow morning getting another car, so we'll have to hit two banks on Wednesday.
He lets me stay here in exchange for shooting coyotes.
What the fuck you do to it?
Can't keep the guns in the trailer days on end.
That's not coming with us in the bank.
Perp took her driver's license, threatened her family if she talked to us.
Mind if I ask you your name, young lady?
Well, Natalie, I want you to know we're gonna have some officers watching your house extra careful till we catch these buggers.
You have my word on that.
Only one man robbed the bank?
He was dressed like a cowpoke except for the ski mask.
I think he ran to a car that was parked out front of the diner.
Well, was it a nice car, an okay car, or a real piece of shit?
It was a real piece of shit.
Oh, that looks like a man who could foreclose on a house.
Natalie, I'm gonna have the officer stay with you till your father arrives.
Didn't happen to have your surveillance cameras on this morning, did you?
Oh, so you have the robbery on video.
What kind of bank would we be if we didn't have video surveillance?
Oh, you'd be a Texas Midlands Bank.
Care to give it a watch while I wander over to the burger joint?
Would you order me something while you're there?
You know I'm part Mexican, too.
Yeah, well, I'm gonna get to that when I'm through with the Indian insults, but it's gonna be a while.
You rangers are an odd bunch.
Let's take a look at that video.
Guess you know about the goingson at the bank.
Jenny Ann waited on a couple of boys, ain't from here.
Y'all been here for a while?
Well, long enough to watch a bank getting robbed that's been robbing me for 30 years.
Oh, you say you've seen them?
I'm pretty sure they were sitting right over there having lunch.
Looked like brothers if you ask me.
Tell me about those handsome young strangers that you waited on.
Based on the fact that you didn't meet me in the parking lot, hollering about the two outoftowners eating here right before a bank robbery.
Well, they didn't mention they was robbing the bank.
And they left it before the bank was robbed, so...
Uh, before this bank was robbed.
I'm gonna need to see them bills.
Mmmm, it's evidence if they're the bank robbers.
So, you go out there and you get a warrant, and you come after the money that I will be using to keep a roof over my daughter's head.
One man hit the bank, just like she said.
Checkered buttondown shirt, jeans, ski mask.
That's all the video will tell us.
They were sitting right over there.
Go wrestle a description from that big sassy girl in the kitchen.
Oh, and get that tip from her.
Oh, and, Alberto, call that motel on 287, get us a room.
Well, this is where the action is.
The days of robbing banks and trying to live to spend the money...
What does Justin want to do when he's grown?
Right now he's dreaming of slinging a football for A&M.
I bet that puckers your red eye.
If he turn left where I turned right, he'll be okay.
Let the world call me a fool Things are right with me and you Yaw.
You came to the right place.
Boy, you'd think there were 10 of me.
Not so fucking tough now, are you, bitch?
Hey, man, he had it coming.
You got some spunk left in you.
You're getting to be old hat at this.
Ah, not the way it would have gone, little brother.
Are you trying to make me mad?
What the hell you talking about?
This is how the fella paid me.
We take it any way you bring it, mister.
You can't lose at poker, not even you.
I'm gonna watch the Aggie game and have a beer.
That's, uh that's quite a stack.
Do you know what Comanche means?
You know what that makes me?
I see his mom in him.
There's no shame in needing the touch of a woman.
Trying to work my little brother?
No, I wasn't doing anything, but I...
You saw there was a stack of chips here.
Bring him up to his room, call your pimp, roll him, drug him, what?
Mind if I sample the goods?
Just got a little drunk at the bar.
How the fuck have you managed to stay out of prison for a year?
Like to pay this out in cash or check?
Four in cash, rest in check.
Who would you like the check made out to?
We would be obliged if you would provide accommodations, though we failed to call ahead.
In your last days in the nursing home, you'll think of me and giggle.
Why won't you answer my prayers?
You begged him for help, and yet you look around at your life and nothing is different.
And so you assume that God has told you no.
Why couldn't we drive back to Lubbock?
'Cause they ain't robbing banks in Lubbock.
We're not gonna watch this, are we?
God doesn't talk through this man any more than he talks through my dog.
Well, then maybe you should give your dog a listen.
You're supposed to be burning sage and dancing around the bed, whooping like a bee stung you.
Come on, I'd rather dance around the fire with a spear.
I'd rather have you stab me with a spear than watch this.
This son of a bitch, he wouldn't know God if he crawled up his pant leg and bit him on the pecker.
Now, this, this is what God watches right here.
Don't worry, they're gonna have soccer highlights on soon enough.
Wow, look at this boy run.
Longhorns are gonna have a good team this year.
That soccer, never could understand that.
Anything a 5yearold can do ain't a sport.
Kickin' around skulls or something, right?
You know, in three weeks, you can watch whatever you want on TV all day.
Hell, you can do it right now in your own room.
Oh, where's the fun in that?
In a year's time, it's my teasing that you're gonna miss.
It's what you'll laugh about when you stand over my grave and wish me well.
Oh, that was a good one.
You'll get the hang of this yet.
Isn't it getting late for you?
Sleeping on the porch, practicing my future.
It's a dangerous thing we do for a living.
having seen it through to the end.
Without me by your side, I doubt you'll get close enough to a criminal to ever be in danger again.
Just when I was starting to feel sorry for you.
Indians ain't supposed to feel sorry for cowboys.
And this makes you the executor?
So, no matter what they charge us with, they can't take it away?
There's no way to trace funds from a casino, all right?
Once you get the checks to the bank, trust is untouchable.
You can't tell nobody nothing, right?
Well, what is there to tell?
I mean, you boys won that money gambling, didn't you?
And those bastards paid the property tax from 2012 to now.
So, $43,000 and you are free and clear.
Just have the loan officer fax me a release of lien, and I'll get that over to the lease manager at Chevron.
The fax number is on the card.
How much you making on this deal?
Not near as much as I'm risking.
You know, they loaned the least they could.
Just enough to keep your mama poor on a guaranteed return.
Thought they could swipe her land for $25,000.
That's just so arrogant, it makes my teeth hurt.
pay those bastards back with their own money?
Well, if that ain't Texan, I don't know what is.
Now, they can foreclose on Friday.
Come hell or high water, be at the bank in Childress on Thursday.
Knowing them fuckers, they will close early.
The trust needs to be managed by a bank.
You really wanna cover your tracks?
You get Texas Midland to handle this trust.
We're gonna watch that bank like a deer feeder.
Now, let's see what they got to eat here.
Hot, and I don't mean the good kind.
Oh, well, uh, I think I'll just, uh...
You know, I've been working here for 44 years.
Ain't nobody ever ordered nothing but Tbone steak and a baked potato.
Except this one asshole from New York tried to order trout back in 1987.
We don't sell no goddamned trout.
So, either you don't want the corn on the cob, or you don't want the green beans.
I don't want green beans either.
Can I get my steak cooked...
Well, I'll tell you one thing.
Nobody's gonna rob this son of a bitch.
Don't report it stolen till Friday.
The guy from Chevron is dropping off the lease agreement.
Are you okay dealing with that by yourself?
You okay being with Debbie by yourself?
Just take the papers, say thank you.
The oil man is the enemy, make no mistake.
I'll be back to the ranch by dark.
Drive like a schoolteacher with all this shit in the back.
Here's the money I owe you.
I guess you'll be selling the ranch.
It's been put in a trust.
It means no one can sell it.
Something else I got to take care of.
How come you ain't in school?
Just twoadays for football right now.
I'm giving the ranch to you and your brother.
Remember going out there when you was little?
What am I supposed to do with a ranch?
You and your brother ain't gonna have to worry about money no more.
you may be hearing a lot of things about me and...
Whatever I hear, I won't believe.
Now, you, you do it different.
You tell me not to be like you, and then you offer me a beer.
I don't want that shit in the car.
We'll be running two cars next time, brother.
We're just gonna sit here and see if this is the branch they rob next.
You wanna drive 80 miles back to Olney and look for more fingerprints that we ain't gonna find?
Or you wanna drive 200 miles back to Lubbock and look at mugshots that don't matter 'cause nobody knows what these sons of bitches look like?
Or we can just wait here for them to rob this bank, which is the one thing I'm pretty damn sure they are going to do.
You're trying to make this last as long as you can because the longer it lasts, the farther you are from that front porch.
No, I'm waitin' for these boys to make a mistake.
So far they ain't, but they will.
And they're gonna make it here.
Got an old hardware store that charges twice what Home Depot does, one restaurant with a rattlesnake for a waitress.
I mean, how is anybody supposed to make a living here?
People have made a living here for 150 years.
Well, people lived in caves for 150,000 years, but they don't do it no more.
A long time ago, your ancestors was the Indians...
till someone came along and killed them, broke 'em down, made you into one of them.
Till the grandparents of these folks took it.
And now, it's been taken from them.
Except it ain't no army doing it.
It's those sons of bitches right there.
Why is it always the sweet ones that are such devils when you get them revved up?
Yeah, you like them pissed off, lookin' for someone to blame.
It's a good thing you're doing.
Go easy on the bank teller tomorrow.
I'll be as gentle as a young nurse.
So we hit the Jayton branch first, then Coleman, right?
Yeah, that should get us what we need.
That's not part of the fucking plan.
The bastards closed down the branch.
What the hell are you doing?
We got to head to Post.
We got to head to Post.
There's only one teller in Coleman.
Whatever we get won't be enough.
We go to Coleman right now.
If that ain't enough, we head to Post.
If we don't leave now for Post, we won't get there till noon.
You don't wanna rob a bank at lunchtime, do you?
Yeah, we don't know the patterns of folks out there.
The patterns are the same everywhere.
We'll leave your car just out of town.
I think I got this figured.
First two banks, they were Texas Midland Banks.
All right, there are seven branches altogether.
The main branch is in Fort Worth.
They're not gonna mess with that.
All right, they hit the branch in Olney.
They hit the one in Archer City.
Alberto, will you please follow me?
Don't let... just keep your mouth shut and just listen to what I'm gonna say.
then there's the one in Childress.
I know that one's closed, Alberto.
They're not gonna mess with the bank in Childress.
The branch in Vernon wasn't Midlands and they hit that.
Then he ran all the way across the road to get to the car.
I think his partner had no idea that was gonna happen.
What does that mean to us?
It means that the only branch that fits the bill is in Post.
Aw, this ain't your first rodeo.
Everybody, get on the fucking ground!
Young ladies, get on the fucking ground! Now!
Open the fucking drawer, young lady!
I said open the motherfucking drawer!
Now get on your motherfucking knees!
The whole goddamn town is shooting at us.
How you doing back there, little brother?

It's not my fault it was payday.
This has gone too far, Tan.
No one was supposed to fucking die.
Texas Midlands in Post has just been hit.
Ah! What did I tell you?
Suspects escaping west in an old Bronco.
All right, Margaret, keep us posted.
These boys are gonna go down.
Let's get some giddyup music going on there.
Snap the fuck out of it.
You got to wrap it up tight.
Front and back, front and back.
Oh, brother, hear me now, hear me clear.
Unless you wanna be a black mark on your sons' lives, I need you mountain lion mean.
Change the money like we planned.
This was your plan, and it worked.

It's your misfortune and none of my own This is what they call white man's intuition.
Sometimes a blind pig finds a truffle.
It's your misfortune and none of my own Back up! Oh, shit!

There's supposed to be two of them.
Maybe the town folks got one.
Well, if they did, they got the smart one.
This old boy is out of his mind.
Why don't you slip up this canyon and tomahawk that son of a bitch?
How well do you know the land around here?
Like the back of my hand.
All right, he's hid up in that brush on that hill.
Can you get me up there behind him?
Give me a half hour, I'll have that bastard field dressed on the hood of my truck.
I can't let you do that.

Taking the only way I can.
They got the road closed at Post.
Everywhere you turn they got the road closed.
You got your license on you?
You oughta let me take the shot.
...definitely something out of a dimestore novel.
Texas Highway Patrol and the locals chased the robbers to this hillside behind me, 20 miles west of town, where the gunfight continued.

We don't know the name of that suspect yet...
Lucky guy Just in the nick of time, too.
Now, this, uh, satisfies both the reverse mortgage loan and the, uh...
and the back taxes that we've paid on your mother's behalf.
We do that as courtesy, of course.

All right, well, I'll... I'll get that faxed over to your attorney by the end of the week.
It is the end of the week.
I wanna watch you do it.
Well, it takes a little time to prepare.
And it's been a pleasure doing business with you.
Let me ask you a question.
Hey, Marcus, ain't you supposed to be retired?
Think I can take a peek at Mr. Howard's file?
I ain't got nothing better to do.
Killed his father in a hunting accident, huh?
I'd love to know what he was hunting in the barn in April.
Before that, he served seven years on bank robbery charges up in Big Spring.
Been trying to track him down, but no luck so far.
You all are off the brother?
There's nothing that links him to the robberies.
Now, what about that little waitress in Vernon?
She said she didn't recognize him.
Pretty upset you took her tips as evidence.
You show that to that old timer?
Yep. He said he didn't look like the fella from the diner.
He didn't recognize Tanner's photo either.
Yeah, tried to get a court order on his bank accounts and the ranch, DA wouldn't do it.
His only court appearance was at his divorce.
He don't fit the bill, Marcus.
People don't start out robbing banks.
They graduate to it like his asshole brother.
Besides, when we was out there, we saw two crews from Chevron capping wells and putting in pumpjacks.
Engineers out there said they're gonna pull off that place.
You just try convincing a judge to issue warrants on somebody set to clear $50,000 a month for robbing $40,000 from the bank that manages the family trust.
You'd think they'd want this thing figured out.
I don't think the bank cares about anything but keeping that trust right where it is.
Hell, they were less cooperative than Toby's attorney.
Marcus, he's not a suspect and you are retired.
I'm the man who killed your brother.
I also know you're retired and you're trespassing.
Well, you could shoot me now and be within your rights.
You toting a gun and all, how convenient.
I figure you got one, too.
I ain't on duty no more.
It's nice out here in this breeze, huh, now that it's cooled down.
I'll figure that out in time.
I know why your brother, Tanner, did it.
He robbed them banks because he liked it.
He shot my partner 300 yards away 'cause he liked it.
If I hadn't blown his shit for brains out, there'd be a new truck out front with jet skis or whatever else he could think to buy.
He'd spend it all just to give an excuse to steal some more.
Each one of them making you a month what you and your brother stole from all four banks combined.
Help me understand why four people died...
so you could steal money that it don't seem you've spent, that it don't seem you need.
They don't got no pumpjacks in their backyard.
By setting this thing in motion.
You expect me to believe your dimwitted brother planned this?
I've been poor my whole life.
So were my parents, their parents before them.
passing from generation to generation, becomes a sickness.
Now, I ain't never killed no one in my life, but if you want me to start with you, let's get on with it, old man.
See if you can grab that pistol before I blast you off this porch.
The hogs are back in the garden.
Feral hogs tearing up this place something fierce.
I'm an old friend of your husband.
I'm just working on the house.
The things we do for our kids, huh?
I'm gonna wash up, be back around 9:00 tomorrow to finish the front.
Start painting the extension and then help Randy with his homework when he gets back from school, okay?
I rent a little house in town.
If you wanna stop by and finish this conversation, you're welcome anytime.
I'm ready to be done with this.
You'll never be done with it no matter what.
It's gonna haunt you, son, for the rest of your days.
If you stop by, maybe I'll give you peace.
Maybe I'll give it to you.
